#  Captcha Backend (Spring Boot + Kaptcha)

This is a Spring Boot-based backend service that generates and validates CAPTCHA images using the [Google Kaptcha](https://github.com/penggle/kaptcha) library. It's useful for protecting your forms from bot submissions.

---

##  Features

- Generate CAPTCHA images in base64 format
- Return a unique `captchaId` with each image
- Validate user-submitted CAPTCHA responses
- Thread-safe in-memory CAPTCHA store
- Compatible with any frontend (React, Angular, etc.)

---

##  Tech Stack

- Java 17
- Spring Boot
- Google Kaptcha 
- Maven (or Gradle)
- ConcurrentHashMap (for in-memory storage)

---

##  Installation & Run

### 1. Clone the repository

```bash
git clone https://github.com/your-username/captcha-backend.git
cd captcha-backend
```
### 2. Build and run

```bash
./mvnw spring-boot:run
```

Server runs on 
```bash
http://localhost:8080
```

### 3. API Endpoints

- Generate Captcha
```bash
GET /api/captcha/generate
```
###### Response
```bash
{
  "captchaId": "0582c4eb-00c3-45ba-a2ef-ee05fd16a0f1",
  "image": "data:/image/png;base64,"
}
```

- Valiadate Captcha
```bash
POST /api/captcha/validate
Content-Type: application/json
```

Body
```bash
{
  "captchaId": "0582c4eb-00c3-45ba-a2ef-ee05fd16a0f1",
  "answer": "6abmdy"
}
```
Response
```bash
true
```
